intro: Daucus syrticus, commonly known as the Syrtic wild carrot, is a flowering plant native to the deserts of North Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a distinctive, fern-like appearance. Daucus syrticus is adapted to arid environments, with deep taproots that help it survive in sandy soils.
